audit_metadata.scope: Full website audit against Master Prompt 6 Non-Negotiables

overall_grade.status: NOT PRODUCTION-READY BY MASTER PROMPT STANDARDS
overall_grade.summary: Website has solid foundation but fails 3 of 6 non-negotiables. Mobile responsiveness incomplete, animations excessive without optimization, visual hierarchy inconsistent.

viewport_meta.evidence: All HTML pages include: <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
viewport_meta.location: index.html line 13, about.html line 13, pricing.html line 13, etc.

breakpoint_strategy.evidence: Uses BOTH mobile-first (min-width) AND desktop-first (max-width) breakpoints inconsistently
breakpoint_strategy.critical_issue: INCONSISTENT METHODOLOGY - Some files follow mobile-first (min-width), others follow desktop-first (max-width). This creates cascade conflicts and unpredictable behavior.

breakpoint_coverage.mobile_320px: ❌ NO SPECIFIC TESTS - Assumed to work but not explicitly designed for
breakpoint_coverage.gap_analysis: Missing explicit handling for small mobile (320-374px), large desktop (1440px+), and 4K displays (3840px+)

touch_targets.evidence: css/mobile-first-base.css lines 17-35 enforce 44x44px minimum touch targets
touch_targets.concern: Only enforced in mobile-first-base.css - not consistent across all stylesheets

font_size_accessibility.critical_issue: Multiple instances of font-size: 14px found (below 16px minimum)
font_size_accessibility.wcag_requirement: Minimum 16px font-size to prevent iOS zoom on form inputs
font_size_accessibility.impact: Users with low vision, iOS users will experience forced zoom on small text

css_load_order.evidence: index.html lines 186-200 show proper CSS layering

responsive_images.critical_issue: Only 4 WebP images out of 85 total. 78 images still in unoptimized JPG/PNG format
responsive_images.performance_impact: Estimated 60-80% larger payload than necessary. Mobile users on slow connections severely impacted.
responsive_images.recommendation: Convert all JPG/PNG to WebP/AVIF with fallbacks. Target: 100% modern format usage.

critical_blockers: Inconsistent breakpoint methodology (min-width vs max-width mixed)
Only 4.7% image optimization (4 WebP out of 85 images)
recommended_actions: 1. UNIFY ALL CSS to min-width mobile-first approach - rewrite about.css, animations.css, appointment.css
2. ADD explicit breakpoints: 320px, 375px, 1440px, 1920px, 3840px
3. REPLACE all font-size: 14px with 16px minimum (animations.css priority)
4. CONVERT 78 JPG/PNG images to WebP/AVIF format
5. IMPLEMENT <picture> elements with srcset for responsive images
6. TEST on real devices: iPhone SE (320px), iPhone 14 Pro (393px), iPad (768px), MacBook Pro (1440px), 4K monitor (3840px)

animation_library.size: Extremely large CSS file dedicated to animations
animation_library.evidence: Lines 1-100 show 7+ core keyframe animations defined

keyframe_animations.quality: Well-structured, purposeful animations with clear use cases

performance_optimization.evidence: None of the animations use will-change or transform: translateZ(0) for GPU acceleration
performance_optimization.concern: All animations run on CPU, causing jank on mobile devices
performance_optimization.mobile_impact: High - Scroll animations will stutter on mid-range Android devices
critical_missing: No will-change: transform on animated elements
No transform: translateZ(0) for GPU layer promotion
No prefers-reduced-motion media query to respect user accessibility settings

accessibility_prefers_reduced_motion.impact: Users with vestibular disorders, motion sensitivity cannot disable animations
accessibility_prefers_reduced_motion.wcag_level: Level AA requirement - MANDATORY for compliance

animation_triggers.evidence: Searched for 'animate' and 'data-aos' attributes in HTML - no results found
animation_triggers.concern: Animations defined but unclear how they're triggered (JavaScript? CSS states?)
animation_triggers.missing_library: No evidence of AOS.js, GSAP, Framer Motion, or similar animation library
animation_triggers.note: Animations may be CSS-only (:hover, :focus) or manually triggered via JS

animation_duration_timing.concern: No slow/long durations defined for complex animations
animation_duration_timing.best_practice: 200-300ms for micro-interactions, 400-600ms for page transitions, 800-1200ms for storytelling

animation_fallbacks.concern: No documentation on what browsers/scenarios trigger fallbacks
animation_fallbacks.best_practice: Should include graceful degradation for browsers without CSS animation support

critical_blockers: Unclear animation trigger system (no AOS/GSAP detected)
2,328-line animations.css file with no lazy-loading strategy
recommended_actions: 1. IMPLEMENT @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) to disable animations for accessibility
2. ADD will-change: transform to all animated elements for GPU acceleration
3. USE transform: translateZ(0) on scroll-triggered elements
4. INSTALL AOS.js or Intersection Observer API for scroll-triggered animations
5. SPLIT animations.css into critical (inline in <head>) and non-critical (lazy-load)
6. ADD animation-duration: 0s inside prefers-reduced-motion media query
7. PROFILE animations on mid-range Android device (Samsung Galaxy A53) to measure jank
8. DOCUMENT animation strategy in ANIMATIONS_DOCUMENTATION.md (already exists - review and update)
